LanguageData.ARA_Plasteel_Shell_Hediff.label: plasteel carapace
LanguageData.ARA_Plasteel_Shell_Hediff.description: By embedding plasteel directly into their shells, the Arachne insects greatly improved their defense power.
LanguageData.ARA_Shell_Thorn_Hediff.label: carapace spine
LanguageData.ARA_Shell_Thorn_Hediff.description: Arachne insects have two rows of spinous tubes embedded in their shells, and when they are not in close combat, they will automatically attack enemies that approach them.
LanguageData.ARA_Reactive_Shell_Hediff.label: reactive carapace
LanguageData.ARA_Reactive_Shell_Hediff.description: The Arachne insect's reactive shell can negate external damage once, but after that the shell will be blown away and lose its defensive power.
LanguageData.ARA_Gene_Essence_Shell_Hediff.label: shell proliferation
LanguageData.ARA_Gene_Essence_Shell_Hediff.descriptio: The shell of this arachnoid is thickened with chitin, giving it additional protection.
LanguageData.ARA_Strengthening_Tendon_Hediff.label: reinforced tendon
LanguageData.ARA_Strengthening_Tendon_Hediff.descript: The Arachne Bug's enhanced tendons allow it to move at high speeds and jump.
LanguageData.ARA_Slide_Patagium_Hediff.label: gliding wing membrane
LanguageData.ARA_Slide_Patagium_Hediff.description: The gliding wing membranes on the legs of Arachne insects allow them to move at high speeds on the bacterial envelope.However, once they leave the bacterial envelope, the effectiveness is quickly lost.
LanguageData.ARA_Slide_Patagium_Hediff.stages.0.label: None
LanguageData.ARA_Huge_Stomach_Hediff.label: additional gastric pouch
LanguageData.ARA_Huge_Stomach_Hediff.description: A directional mutation in the Arachnidae family allows them to have larger stomach pouches and store more nutrients.
LanguageData.ARA_Internal_Circulation_Lung_Hediff.des: A directed mutation in the Arachnidae family allows its lungs to self-circulate and withstand near-vacuum insults.
LanguageData.ARA_Cycle_Suppression_Hediff.label: Life cycle control
LanguageData.ARA_Cycle_Suppression_Hediff.description: Life cycle inhibitors of the Arachnid insects suppress their disordered growth and extend their lifespans.
LanguageData.ARA_Acidling_Pouch_Hediff.label: Explosive egg sac
LanguageData.ARA_Acidling_Pouch_Hediff.description: The egg sacs of Arachne insects contain many explosive species that are about to hatch, and upon receiving a command, they immediately fly out and attack the enemy.
LanguageData.ARA_Tumor_Pouch_Hediff.label: mycocele egg sac
LanguageData.ARA_Tumor_Pouch_Hediff.description: The egg sacs of Arachnidae contain fungal aneurysms, which, when released, transform the surrounding ground into a fungal blanket.
